Community News March 2002

03 Apr 2002

Travelling down under

\n

joxn, our evolter from Germany, has been more than 17,000 km away from home for the past six months. Working in Sydney as a part of his Information Technology study on projects involving Mozilla and Embedded Linux. Pictures can be found on his personal web page.

More working notes

Also, Marlene just got done\nwith a two-week contract gig in Houston, TX. The work was for\nChevronTexaco, doing the UI design for a Plumtree portal project, and\ncranking out the style guide. She tried to call Bob and\nHeather who live relatively nearby, but never got 'em :o(.

Isaac and Nick from Triple Zero Digital have also had a busy month,\nlaunching a couple of redesigns (Media Makeup Academy, NetCraft Australia), and a few smaller sites (Adelaide All Spas, Suit For Hire, Sidetrack Adventures).

\n

Not exactly a beervolt, but...

...Marlene, Amanda and Erika met in\nPortland the weekend of March 15 for some yummy sushi and rousing\nconversation. They were joined by Marlene's beau Richard and Amanda's\nhubby Tom. The girls met the next afternoon over coffee and laughed\nso hard tears were shed. Pictures on Marlene's site.

\n

\n\nThis missed last month's roundup because we didn't have pictures, but at the end of February, Bob was godfather to MartinB's wee boy, Morgan. More pictures? We got em.\n

Submissions

\n

The evolt.org Monthly Recap is a summary of awards, meetings, and fresh opportunities relevant to all of us. Submitted items from month to month may be of varying relevance to others depending on the number of opportunities. The important thing, though, is that you can share more about yourself, and learn more about the people that make up the evolt.org community. If you want to know more, please read the the evolt.org Monthly Recap introductory article.

\n

If you're proud of it, send it in. Don't be shy.

\n

Please send all submissions via the contact form. Any queries or clarifications can be sent via the same method.
